titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B151b
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B151b

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

1.[hwfʿśt | bn | śmrm | sqny | syn | ḏ-ʾlm | nfs-s | w-ʾ]ḏn-s | w-w[ld-s | w-qny-s | w-mslmhn | ḏ-l-sm | ywm | ... ... | ḏ-q=] 2.[ny | w-bʿl | ... | bnhy | ʾʿrś | ...ly | ḏ-ʾmʿdm |] b-mwfr [| ḏ-tḥrbhn | b-ṯlm | ywm | ṣry | syn | ḏ-ʾlm | ...n | mwqrthn |]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.his [...] and 2.in the cultivated lan[d]
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Hawafīʿathat bin Śamīrum dedicated to Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm himself and] his faculties and [his children and his possessions and (this) altar which they possess when … which he pos-] 2.[sessed and gained legal possession of … the sons of ʾAʿriś … Dhū-ʾAmʿādim] in the cultivated land [of Dhū-Taḥribhān in Thalam, when Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm protected … the cutting(?) …]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
his ... and
in the cultivated land
Restored full text of the inscription:
Hawafīʿathat bin Śamīrum dedicated to Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm himself and his faculties and his children and his possessions and this altar which they possess when … which he pos-
sessed and gained legal possession of … the sons of ʾAʿriś … Dhū-ʾAmʿādim in the cultivated land of Dhū-Taḥribhān in Thalam, when Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm protected … the cutting? …

in the cultivated land
